Monkey Eats his 
 Own Tail 
 
 Mozambican folktale 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Once upon a time the 
 
 rabit was a great friend of 
 
 the monkey. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One day the rabit 
 
 said: 
 
 Let's go for a walk 
 
 and lok for 
 
 something to eat. 
 
 The monkey agred, 
 
 but it was a trap for him! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 They went to a field of 
 
 maize and started to eat it. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But the clever rabit 
 
 had spoken to the 
 
 owners of the farm, to 
 
 catch the monkey and 
 
 show him he was folish. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The clever rabit started 
 
 shouting: 
 
 Robers! Robers! 
 
 Your maize is al gone! 
 
 And he jumped up and ran 
 
 away. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Sudenly the owners 
 
 apeared and found 
 
 the monkey trying to 
 
 run away. But he has a 
 
 long tail and it was 
 
 stoping him. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The owners folowed 
 
 him, shouting: 
 
 Stop! Stop! 
 
 We saw you, you are 
 
 the monkey. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But they caught him and 
 
 started beating him. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 He couldn't stand the 
 
 pain so he said: 
 
 I was with my friend 
 
 rabit. He is the one who 
 
 invited me. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But the owners cut his tail 
 
 of and told him: 
 
 Go and tel your friend that 
 
 we cut of your tail! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Then they went to the 
 
 rabit's house and 
 
 coked the monkey's 
 
 tail to eat. 
 
 
 
 The rabit invited the 
 
 monkey for lunch. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 At the end of the meal 
 
 the rabit asked the 
 
 monkey if he knew 
 
 what he had eaten. 
 
 
 
 The folish monkey 
 
 answered: No, I don't! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The rabit told him that 
 
 he had eaten his own tail 
 
 and then ran away. 
 
 
 
 And from then on they 
 
 became enemies! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 13
